entries.content:
Now I have a clear understanding of the project. It's a static HTML personal profile page with existing Open Graph and Twitter Card metadata. I need to add Schema.org Person structured data in JSON-LD format.

Let me create the implementation plan:

entries.content: Now let me record the codebase discoveries and create the build progress file:

entries.detail: [{'type': 'text', 'text': "Recorded discovery for 'index.html': Static HTML personal profile page for Abe Diaz. Contains existing Open Graph and Twitter Card meta tags in <head>. Person data available: name (Abe Diaz), jobTitle (Sr. Technical Program Manager), employer (Disaster Relief by Amazon), url (https://abediaz.ai/), image (/images/profile.jpg), social links (LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram)."}]

entries.content:
I've read the spec and created the implementation plan. Here's a summary:

## Implementation Plan Created ✅

### Feature: Add Structured Data JSON-LD for Person Schema

**Overview:** Add Schema.org Person structured data in JSON-LD format to the `<head>` section of `index.html` to improve search engine understanding and enable rich snippets.

### Phases & Subtasks:

| Phase | Subtask | Description | Est. Time |
|-------|---------|-------------|-----------|
| **1. Implementation** | 1.1 | Add JSON-LD Person Schema to index.html | 10 min |
| **2. Validation** | 2.1 | Validate JSON-LD syntax | 5 min |

### Data to Include in JSON-LD:
- **@type:** Person
- **name:** Abe Diaz
- **jobTitle:** Sr. Technical Program Manager
- **worksFor:** Amazon (Disaster Relief by Amazon)
- **url:** https://abediaz.ai/
- **image:** https://abediaz.ai/images/profile.jpg
- **sameAs:** LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram URLs
- **description:** From existing meta description

### Files to Modify:
- `index.html` - Add JSON-LD script tag after Twitter meta tags in `<head>`

### Final Acceptance Criteria:
1. JSON-LD Person schema is present in the `<head>` section
2. Schema follows Schema.org Person specification
3. All person data (name, job, employer, social links, image) is included
4. JSON-LD syntax is valid
5. HTML page still renders correctly
I'll implement subtask 1.1 to add JSON-LD structured data for Person schema. Let me start by reading the spec and understanding the codebase structure.
Now I'll add the JSON-LD Person schema to the HTML head section. Based on the acceptance criteria and the existing content in the HTML, I'll create the structured data with all the required fields.

entries.content: Excellent! I've successfully added the JSON-LD Person schema to the HTML. Now let me verify the JSON syntax is valid and commit the changes.
[Bash] Error: Could not parse command for security validation: node -e "const content = require('fs').readFileSync
entries.detail: Could not parse command for security validation: node -e "const content = require('fs').readFileSync('./index.html', 'utf8'); const match = content.match(/<script type=\"application\/ld\+json\">([\s\S]*?)<\/script>/); if (match) { try { JSON.parse(match[1]); console.log('✓ JSON-LD is valid JSON'); } catch (e) { console.error('✗ JSON-LD is invalid:', e.message); process.exit(1); } } else { console.error('✗ No JSON-LD found'); process.exit(1); }"

entries.content: Let me create a simple validation script to check the JSON-LD syntax:

entries.content: [Bash] Error: Could not parse command for security validation: python3 -c "import json, re; content = open('./inde
entries.detail: Could not parse command for security validation: python3 -c "import json, re; content = open('./index.html').read(); match = re.search(r'<script type=\"application/ld\+json\">([\s\S]*?)</script>', content); jsonld = json.loads(match.group(1)) if match else exit(1); print('✓ JSON-LD is valid JSON'); print(f'✓ @context: {jsonld[\"@context\"]}'); print(f'✓ @type: {jsonld[\"@type\"]}'); print(f'✓ name: {jsonld[\"name\"]}'); print(f'✓ All required fields present')"

✓ JSON-LD is valid JSON
✓ @context: https://schema.org
✓ @type: Person
✓ name: Abe Diaz
✓ jobTitle: Sr. Technical Program Manager
✓ worksFor: Amazon (Disaster Relief by Amazon)
✓ url: https://abediaz.ai/
✓ image: https://abediaz.ai/images/profile.jpg
✓ sameAs: 3 links
✓ description: present

✓ All required fields are present and valid

entries.content: Excellent! The JSON-LD is valid. Now let me clean up the validation scripts and commit the changes.
Now let me update the implementation plan to mark this subtask as completed:
